Hampshire combines scattered population centers with a fairly typical English rural landscape. The main population center is the South Hampshire conurbation (Portsmouth and Southampton and their respective suburbs) with smaller population centers like Basingstoke and Winchester to the north. A fair chunk of the South Downs National Park lies within the county.
Basically English only although Southampton has a fair sized Polish speaking community and the area around Aldershot and Farnborough is home to thousands of Nepali speakers.

to Portsmouth), with the A27 'The South Coast Road' running alongside the M27 Motorway. Also the M271, M275, A3M, A30, A31, A33, A34, A35, A36, A303, A331 and A338.

There is a frequent train service from London Waterloo station to Portsmouth and Southampton that passes through much of the Hampshire countryside, also it has a train service feeding the South Coast from Southampton to Portsmouth, it also has services to cities, including

value: Many sites in Hampshire are associated with the English writer Jane Austen who lived in the county most of her life.

is a cafe in the heart of the Hampshire country side.  It is situated in the grounds of Breamore House

value: content=Located between Andover and Newbury, once referred to as being 'invitingly snug', this family-run Victorian country house hotel is small, unpretentious, yet stylish.
